intro: Leucanthemum vulgare var. subglaucum, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the blue to violet flower head, which is surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, often found in meadows and woodland edges.
